Sorting algorithms
Bubble sort
Bubble sort improved
Compare the number %1$d with the number %2$d
Since there were no permutations, the array is sorted!
Swap %1$d and %2$d because the number %3$d is greater than the number %4$d
The numbers %1$d and %2$d are in the correct order
The numbers %1$d and %2$d have successfully swapped
Select the range for permutations from %1$d to %2$d
The last number in this range pops up like a bubble
Selection sort
Select the minimum number for the position %1$d, current minimum: %2$d
Compare the current minimum %1$d with the number %2$d
The current minimum is greater than the number %1$d so now this number is minimum
The current minimum is less than the number %1$d so we don\'t change anything
Found a new minimum %1$d for the position %2$d so let\'s swap the numbers
Now the number %1$d is the minimum for this position
The number %1$d is already the minimum for this position
Insertion sort
Select the subarray to insert
The subarray is sorted!
Looking for a new position for the number %1$d in the subarray
Compare %1$d with the number %2$d
We don\'t do anything because %1$d is greater than the number %2$d
Shift the number %1$d because it\'s greater than %2$d
Found a new position for the number %1$d in the subarray
The position for the number %1$d has not changed in the subarray
Merge sort
Divide the array into parts
Compare the number %1$d with the number %2$d
The number %1$d is smaller so we move it to the correct position
Moving the number %1$d to the correct position
The subarrays were successfully merged with each other
Quick sort (Lomuto)
Quick sort (Hoare)
Selecting the range of the array
Selecting the pivot number
We go from the beginning of the array, compare the number %1$d with the pivot
We go from the end of the array, compare the number %1$d with the pivot
We go through the array with index i
We go through the array with index j and compare it with index j
Compare the number %1$d at index i with the pivot
The number %1$d is less than the pivot, we do nothing
The number %1$d is more than the pivot, we do nothing
The number %1$d is less than the pivot, leave it for exchange
The number %1$d is more than the pivot, leave it for exchange
The number %1$d at index i is less than or equal to the pivot
The number %1$d at index i is more than the pivot, we do nothing
The indices are not equal so we swap the numbers
The indices are equal so we do nothing
Swapping the numbers
The pivot number and %1$d should be swapped
The numbers %1$d and %2$d should be swapped
The array is successfully sorted relative to the pivot
